overall.description: Return a full array with the same shape and type as a given array.

a.description: The shape and data-type of a define these same attributes of the returned array.

dtype.description: Overrides the data type of the result.

order.description: Overrides the memory layout of the result. ‘C’ means C-order, ‘F’ means F-order, ‘A’ means ‘F’ if a is Fortran contiguous, ‘C’ otherwise. ‘K’ means match the layout of a as closely as possible.

subok.description: If True, then the newly created array will use the sub-class type of ‘a’, otherwise it will be a base-class array. Defaults to True.

shape.type: int or sequence of ints, optional.
shape.description: Overrides the shape of the result. If order=’K’ and the number of dimensions is unchanged, will try to keep order, otherwise, order=’C’ is implied.  New in version 1.17.0.

out.description: Array of fill_value with the same shape and type as a.
